article_rec.title: Design and Realization of a High-Performance Integrated Attitude Determination System and Hybrid Simulation

abstract.par: A high-performance integrated attitude determination system based on multi-sensor is proposed and implemented, which is suitable for high resolution of ground stabiLity and agile mobile observation of the new generation earth observation micro-satelLites. This system includes the sensitive subsystem, the signal collecting and preprocessing subsystem and the comprehensive processing subsystem. The sensitive subsystem is integrated by four types of sensitive components sub-software, which include the star sensitive probe, the Sun sensitive probe, the fiber-optic gyroscope and the magnetic probe. The signal collecting and preprocessing subsystem, implemented by the FPGA module and its periphery cirCuit, receives output data from the four types of sensitive probe in parallel, and accompLish the data smoothing and preprocessing. According to the SunLight information, starLight information, inertial information and information based on magnetic after they are smoothness and pretreatment, the comprehensive processing subsystem, with ARM module as the core, adopts the combination attitude determination method based on the ant colony particle filter algorithm to reaLize the high-performance attitude determination of the system. Aiming at the integration needs of micro-satelLites, a kind of multi-sensor integrated attitude determination system structure of small volume, Light weight, high level of integration, high reLiabiLity is designed. Finally, tests and experiments based on the integrated attitude determination system were conducted, which meet the design requirements.

keywords.kw: Integrated Attitude Determination System, Multi-sensor, Ant Colony Particle Filter Algorithm

article_rec.title: Design an Intelligent Environment Control System for GreenHouse Based on RS485 Bus

abstract.par: As control equipments used in industry can hardly be transplanted to greenHouse environment control directly,and the greenHouse control systems designed in the past are not that adaptable in practice, a new greenHouse control system based on RS485 bus is reaLized in this paper. When the system is running normally, the control targets are fulfilled by smart modules distributed in every greenHouse, while data collecting, state monitoring and remote login are accompLished by upper PC. If manual control is needed, auto-control will be isolated in two levels, which ensures the greenHouses can be controlled if system malfunction or extreme cLimate happens.

keywords.kw: smart greenHouse, auto-control, DSP, sensors, virtual instrument

article_rec.title: Design and ASIC Implementation of High-Speed DDC

abstract.par: This paper presents a High-speed Digital Down Converter, in which speed is improved and hardware is saved with the traditional Distributed Arithmetic. The presented NCO based on the modified distributed arithmetic and the filter bank based on polyphase reaLizations of FIR filters have been implemented. The DDC's input sample rate can reach 10MSPS in the 200MHz system clock. The simulation results indicate that the SFDR of DDC presented in this paper can reach to about 70dB.

keywords.kw: DDC, High-speed, modified cordic Arithmetic

article_rec.title: Design and Development Control System for Deep-Fertilization Variable Liquid Fertilizer Applicator

abstract.par: In order to improve Liquid fertiLizer efficiency, Liquid variable fertiLizing control system was designed with two working modes: a manual control and an automatic control mode. Taking the S3C44B0X microprocessor of ARM7 series as the core device, according to the fertiLizing amount of the current location, the system was able to combined together for the machine speed and access to data, and the fertiLizing amount from digital quantity to the flow of Liquid output was transformed. Flow Sensor was taken, a closed-loop feedback regulation to control the opening of electrical actuators was formed, adjusted valve opening to compete the variable fertiLization. The test results in the field showed that the relative error of the variable fertiLizing amount was less than 5%, When the fertiLizing amount was 245-294kg/hm2, the system can reaLize the requirements of variable fertiLizing.

keywords.kw: Precision Agriculture, Liquid Variable Rate FertiLize, ARM, Closed-loop Feedback System

article_rec.title: Design and Implementation of Fishery Forecasting System Based on Radial Basis Function Neural Network

abstract.par: This article introduces the design and implementation of a fishery forecasting system based on Radial Basis Function (RBF) neural network. The system was developed using the CLient/Server architecture, the C# programming language in the environment of Visual Studio 2008 on the Windows7 platform. It draws knowledge from RBF neural network theory, the production historical data of pelagic fishery and the marine environment data. The system uses the Object-Oriented analysis and design method. It can quickly obtain the forecast results available to users through inputting marine environment data information and the RBF neural network model. The forecasting system includes three major functional modules, namely preprocessing fishery production data, matching production data and environmental data, training RBF neural network and making predictions. Experiments have shown that this forecasting system can generate accurate and effective pelagic fishery knowledge.

keywords.kw: Radial Basis Function, Fishery Forecasting, System Design

article_rec.title: Design and Implementation of the Accumulating Algorithm of Digital Signal Averager

abstract.par: To satisfy the need of on-board accumulation in time-of-fLight mass spectrometer (TOF-MS) appLications, the paper presents an accumulation algorithm in FPGA based on PipeLine and ping-pong operation. The accumulation algorithm is verified on a signal averager hardware platform which takes XILiNX VIRTEX-5 FPGA as the processing core. The caChe module, on-chip accumulation, and USB transmission module is implemented. Testing results show that the range of time measurement is 32us, the minimum time resolution is 333ps and signal to noise ratio (SNR) is improved effectively. The accumulation algorithm is stable and reLiable, so it can be widely used in the measurement of high-resolution time interval and pulse ampLitude.

keywords.kw: Time-to-digital Converter, Digital-Signal-Averager, Accumulation Algorithm, FPGA

article_rec.title: Design and Realization of Testing and Analyzing Apparatus for Automobile Clutch

abstract.par: To solve the problem of vehicle test in the course of the clutch production and design, the clutch testing and analyzing apparatus based on the output characteristics of the clutch pedal force and displacement is designed. The USB high-speed data acquisition technology is used. By the high-speed data processing abiLity of PC, the characteristic points of the force and displacement curve are analysed. It can obtain the characteristic value of clutch pedal and provide the experiment basis of the design of clutch. They include the max pedal load, the max pedal travel, the free path, the engagement point, the disengagement point, the synchronisation point etc. The experiment results show that the clutch in a real car can be measured and analyzed very well. The system time resolution is 0.1ms. The displacement measuring accuracy is 1.5mm and the force measuring accuracy is 2N.

keywords.kw: clutch, pedal, measuring apparatus, high-speed data acquisition

article_rec.title: Design and Research of Virtual Assembly System Based on OSG

abstract.par: For the excessively high assembly costs in manufacturing, the paper studies the integration of the assembly technology and virtual reaLity technology, interactive virtual environment and other key technical issues. By using open source cross-platform appLication development interface in OSG scene graph, it creates a virtual assembly system to achieve assembly evaluation, optimization of assembly planning and virtual training.

keywords.kw: OSG, virtual assembly, assembly planning

article_rec.title: Design Method of Modular Units for Articulated in-Pipe Robot Inspecting System

abstract.par: A novel untethered autonomous motor driven in-pipe robot inspecting system has been designed in order to solve the internal defect inspection for long-distance pipeLine. Which includes motor driven traction robot and other multiple cyLindrical box modular units, the adjacent units are Linked by double hook joints and by three extended supporting wheels contacting the inner surface of pipe elastically to form the articulated multi-body system. Based on the virtual prototype technology, by means of the relations of structure and size for modular units and its connectors, to research the determine method of structure size meeting the needs of in-pipe robot inspecting system moved in elbow pipe. The method proposed this paper has been used in the design of engineering prototype, and whose structure size and mechanics performance have been proved can achieve the design indexes.

keywords.kw: in-pipe robot, articulated modular units, abiLity of passthrough elbow pipe

article_rec.title: Design of CMOS Image Sensor's Initialization Based on FPGA

abstract.par: CMOS image sensor can convert analog video signals into digital video signals, so the initiaLization of CMOS image sensor is essential to image capture and processing system. This paper briefly introduces the specification of I2C bus and working principle of COMS image sensor, then it detailedly presents a new design of I2C bus controller which can initiaLize CMOS image sensor. The I2C bus controller programmed by Verilog hardware description language based on FPGA has three function modules. According to the given block diagram of the I2C bus controller, this paper focuses on analyzing the designing tHought of each module and the transform process of the I2C bus state. Finally, the function of Controller is verified according to the simulation test and the initiaLization of COMS Image Sensor is implemented through the hardware cirCuit successfully.

keywords.kw: FPGA, CMOS image sensor, I2C bus, Verilog HDL

article_rec.title: Design of Intelligent Wheeled Robot Based on Multi-sensors

abstract.par: In this paper a wheeled mobile robot and multi-sensors fusing technology are introduced based on the embedded controller of the S3C2410. The function modules of the robot with avoiding obstacle, automatically tracking are analyzed. The ultrasonic ranging, image tracking, and speed detection cirCuits are designed, which adopted multi-sensor fusing arithmetic, reaLized intelLigent control of wheeled mobile robot. The controller has many advantages, such as simple hardware cirCuit, modularization structure, and extensible interface, and so on.

keywords.kw: multi-sensor, tracking automatically, wheeled robot, obstacle avoidance

article_rec.title: Design of the Control System for a Hexapod Walking Robot

abstract.par: In this paper, the structure of a mammal-Like hexapod walking robot is presented and the joint trajectory planning method of tripod gait is analyzed. The motions with 12 degrees of freedom (DOF) for the robot are reaLized by 12 rudder servos. The control pulse width send to each servomotor determines the motor position. The control system is composed of two layers with different function. Coordination-layer is a PC for regulating the whole system. It calculates each joint's expected trajectory according to user's definitions, and then transmits the objective position data to execution-layer through serial port. The execution-layer uses a ARM7 based microprocessor LPC2132 as core controller. It adopts time sLicing method and three timer-interrupt programs are employed to drive 12 rudder servos coordinately for reaLizing the steady walking of the robot.

keywords.kw: hexapod walking robot, control system, joint trajectory planning, ARM7 controller

article_rec.title: Detection of Corn Plant Population and Row Spacing Using Computer Vision

abstract.par: In this paper we present a new vision-based method to measure corn plant spacing and population at early growth stage. Images were acquired from a top-mounted camera under dayLight condition. Algorithms were developed to mosaic image sequence, vegetation segmentation, image thinning, stem center identification, row Line fitting, plant count and plant spacing measurement. Compared the results of vision-based system with manual stand counts in 3 varieties with 10 repetitions of 10 m sections of corn rows. Our system was well correlated to mannual stand count, and corn plant spacing estimation had no significant difference with manual stand measurements.

keywords.kw: Image sequence, Computer vision, Plant population, Plant spacing, Precision agriculture

article_rec.title: Determine of Rubber Parameters of Finite Element Model

abstract.par: Finite element analysis technology is an effective approach to research on mechanics performance of rubber component, but it is difficult to estabLish accurate finite element analysis model. Uncertainty of rubber parameter make theoretical analysis impossible quantitative. Rubber parameter of single metal floating face seals are gained accurately by adapting the theoretical analysis and tests, which break through the Limit of quaLitative analysis. The finite element model can simulate the assemble process of single metal floating face seal accurately, which is great significance to theoretical analysis and practical appLication. The research can provide the reference for rubber components in relative fields to analysis mechanically by adopting finite element software.

keywords.kw: Finite Element Analysis, rubber parameter, single metal seal

article_rec.title: Development and Application of Economic Evaluation Software for Seafloor Massive Sulfide Deposits

abstract.par: Seafloor massive sulfides have the potential to become a significant mineral resource because of ample contents of Au, Ag, Cu, Zn, and Pb. In this paper, economic evaluation software for seafloor massive sulfide deposits is developed. A project of seafloor massive sulfides is selected as an appLication of the software. By sensitive analysis, some important factors to affect the economic feasibiLity are clarified. Quantitative information necessary for a more accurate evaluation is also discussed in this paper.

keywords.kw: Massive sulfides, economic evaluation software, sensitive analysis

article_rec.title: Development of Analytical Software for Dynamic Microscopic Granule Based on C#

abstract.par: The CCD slow-motion camera was used for continuously shooting granulometric micro-image in order to reaLize dynamically and continuously gathering granulometric micro-images. The VC.NET in VS2008 IDE was used for developing the analytical software for dynamic granulometer. It can do real-time analyses for particles in consideration of the dynamics and continuity of granulometric micro-image continuous acquisition. After experimental verification, the software can be used for real-time detection of various powders.

keywords.kw: granule analysis, image manipulation, micro-image

article_rec.title: Development of the Multiple Power Detection and Faulty Isolation System for Mobile Robots

abstract.par: The paper presents a multiple power detection and faulty isolation system for mobile robots. The system contains four power detection units, a data integration unit, a controller and a supervised computer, and measures four variety power values on real-time. Each power unit uses four current sensors to measure the current variety of the mobile robot, and use multilevel multisensor fusion algorithm to calculate the exact current value, and isolates faulty measured value to improve the current status to be exact using the redundant management algorithm and statistical signal prediction algorithm. We use the proposed algorithms to be appLied in voltage detection, too. We design the power detection and faulty isolation system using HOLTEK microchip. The power detection unit can communicate with the data integration unit via I2C interface. The controller of the mobile robot communicates with the data integration unit via RS232 interface. The main controller can decide the residual time under the critical power for each power detection unit of the mobile robot using auto-regression algorithm.

keywords.kw: power detection, faulty isolation system, mobile robot, multisensor fusion algorithm, redundant management algorithm, statistical signal prediction algorithm, auto-regression algorithm

article_rec.title: Digital Radioscopy (DR) and CT Testing Technology Research for Key Parts in Railway Rolling Stock

abstract.par: it introduces the theory of digital radioscopy(DR) &CT testing technology, according to analyze actuaLity of testing for railway key parts and advantage of digital radioscopy(DR) &CT testing technology, and research the feasibiLity for making the technology use in railway rolLing stock key parts, it concludes that the digital radioscopy(DR) &CT testing technology can fit the testing requirements of railway rolLing stock key parts.

keywords.kw: railway rolLing stock, key parts, non-destructive testing, digital radioscopy (DR) &CT testing technology

article_rec.title: Dimensional Variation Analysis of Compliant Sheet Metal Assembly

abstract.par: In order to assure the dimensional quaLity of compLiant sheet metal assembly, it is quite necessary to use the numerical method to simulate and analyze the assembly process before real assembly. In this paper, the finite element analysis of the whole compLiant sheet metal assembly process is reaLized in two steps: clamping force calculation and joining and springing back simulation. Clamping force is optimized so that the initial gap between parts can be closed. The joints of the two parts are simulated by DOF coupLing in ANSYS. Spring-back force, which is assumed to be equal to the optimum clamping force, is appLied on the joint points. Large displacement static analysis is run in ANSYS to calculate the displacement distribution of both clamped part and compLiant sheet metal assembly. An example of compLiant sheet metal assembly by lap joints is studied to demonstrate the finite element analysis process in this paper.

keywords.kw: Dimensional variation, CompLiant sheet metal assembly, Finite element analysis

article_rec.title: Distributed Beamforming Design on Amplify and Forward Two-Way Relaying Channels

abstract.par: A distributed scenario of ampLify-and-forward (AF) two-way relaying channel, where two single antenna equipped source nodes exchange data through M distributed relays, is studied in this work. The relays are all equipped with one antenna and with individual power constraint while helping source nodes transmitting their data. A scaled-and-forward (SF) beam forming strategy is first introduced, and it follows an optimal distributed beam forming design based on minimizing the sum of mean square errors (MSMSE) of both source nodes. This system model is then extended to a MIMO scenario, where source nodes are equipped with multiple antennas. Transmit beam forming and receive beam forming of two communication nodes are jointly designed with the relay beam forming in this sCheme. A generative iterative algorithm is proposed for the MSMSE-based sChemes. Simulation results show that, system performance is greatly enhanced by the optimal beam forming, and with multiple antennas at two source nodes, the system performance is further improved due to the increased space diversity.

article_rec.title: Distribution Characteristics of Low-Temperature and Freezing Damage of Featured Fruit Trees Based on GIS and Distance to Coastline in Fujian Province

abstract.par: Using DEM (digital elevation model) data of 1:250,000 and temperature data of 68 weather stations in Fujian Province, based on the geography and cLimate equation that formed of longitude, latitude, altitude and annual extreme minimum temperature, the annual extreme minimum temperature was fine simulated by the factor of distance to the coastLine. Then the simulated results were amended by the topographic factors of slope and aspect. The distribution characteristics of the featured fruit trees (longan, Litchi, Chinese oLives) to avoid freezing was gotten combined with the freezing index in Fujian Province. The results showed that: The simulation of extreme minimum temperature is better because of the fusion from the factor of distance to the coastLine. The distribution characteristics of freezing level of the featured fruit trees are affected by the higher degree of geographical factors. The results correspond with the actual situation.

keywords.kw: Geographic Information System, distance to the coastLine, low-temperature simulation, distribution characte-ristics, featured fruit trees

article_rec.title: Distribution Model Based on Active Service

abstract.par: Based on the theory and tHought of active Service, handLing the support notion and mode of active logistics, and making use of the advanced technique about Internet of things, This paper discusses the issue of active distribution in supply chain, integrity to information, interaction to resources, supervision to state and coordination to Link.

keywords.kw: Active Service, Active Logistics, Active Distribution, Supply Chain, Internet of things

article_rec.title: Disturbance-Observed-Based-Control Design of the Drag-Free Satellite

abstract.par: The controller design of the drag-free satelLite on near-earth orbit is the researching object. After analyzing the characteristics of the main disturbances affecting the drag-free satelLite, the disturbance model is estabLished. Adding the disturbance to the system, a disturbance observed based dynamics model of the drag-free satelLite is built. Then the mixed controller is designed and the LMI form is given to solve it. Simulation results verify the stabiLity and feasibiLity of the controller.

keywords.kw: the drag-free satelLite, disturbance observer, accelerometer mode, displacement mode

article_rec.title: Division Characteristics of Agricultural Climate Dry and Wet in Fujian Province Based on GIS

abstract.par: Surface dry and wet conditions can be on behalf of the water balance in a region, and also be as a major indicator of the soil moisture deficit in agriculture, so has an important influence on drought and flood of agricultural meteorological disasters. Based on the 30 years of cLimate data of Fujian province, the humidity index of evapotranspiration model in it has been analyzed, the cLimatic divisions are done, the mainly conclusions are as fellows: According to the classification of humidity index indicators, it was divided into four cLimate types of Fujian Province Area: Central-southern drought region I, Middle more humid region II, Northwestern wet region III and Most humid local region IV. It discussed the different the characteristics of the agricultural meteorological disasters such as drought and flood. The research can be the theoretical basis for the agricultural disaster prevention and the sustainable ecological development.

keywords.kw: agricultural meteorological disasters, humidity index, division of cLimatic characteristics, GIS (Geographical information system), Fujian province

article_rec.title: Double Inverted Pendulum Control Based on Three-loop PID and Improved BP Neural Network

abstract.par: To deal with the defects of BP neural networks used in balance control of inverted pendulum, such as longer train time and converging in partial minimum, this article reaLizes the control of double inverted pendulum with improved BP algorithm of artificial neural networks(ANN), builds up a training model of test simulation and the BP network is 6-10-1 structure. Tansig function is used in hidden layer and PureLin function is used in output layer, LM is used in training algorithm. The training data is acquried by three-loop PID algorithm. The model is learned and trained with Matlab calculating software, and the simuLink simulation experiment results prove that improved BP algorithm for inverted pendulum control has higher precision, better astringency and lower calculation. This algorithm has wide appLication on nonLinear control and robust control field in particular.

keywords.kw: artificial neural networks, improved back propagation algorithm, double inverted pendulum, three-loop pid

article_rec.title: Driving Intentions Identification Based on Continuous P-2D HMM

abstract.par: The improved P-2D HMM is introduced to the driving intentions identification, and the driving intentions identification model based on continuous P-2D HMM was estabLished to identify the driving intention. The vehicle space, speed and lateral acceleration were as inputs, the driving intentions as output. Predict the driving behavior at next period to further enhance active safety. This paper choice the two driving intentions, the speed up or keeping speed and lane-changing or keeping lane, as the two-dimensional of the C-P2D-HMM hidden state, and separately identify of driving intention. Model vaLidation results show that the model can identify driving intentions accurate at the given conditions.

keywords.kw: P-2D HMM model, mixture Gaussian density function, Driving Intentions Identification

article_rec.title: Dynamic Performance Simulation on Complex Hydraulic Press System

abstract.par: The hydrauLic press system for forging is very important equipment in aerospace industry. Since this kind of system is very complex, such as flow nonLinear, this will cause that its dynamic performance is difficult to obtain. In this paper, a simulation based dynamic performance analysis method is proposed to analyze the system dynamics. First, a simulation model of the hydrauLic press system is built based on the commercial software AMESim, upon which its dynamic performance is analyzed and estimated. The simulation results show the effectiveness of the proposed method.

keywords.kw: Dynamic simulation, AMESim, hydrauLic press system, forging

article_rec.title: Dynamic Programming Algorithm Based Path Planning of the Multiple Robot System

abstract.par: The article researChed the path planning of the multiple mobile robots moving to the target position in the unknown environment, and used the dynamic programming algorithm to solve the minimum displacement techniques on the supervised computer. The mobile robot has the shape of cyLinder and its diameter, height and weight is 10cm, 15cm and 1.5kg. The controller of the mobile robot is MCS-51 microchip, and programs Keil-C language to control the mobile robot. The mobile robot contains a controller module (including two DC motor drivers), an obstacle detection module, a voice module, a wireless RF module, an encoder module, and a compass module. The mobile robot can modify the error of the orientation using the compass module, and uses encoder module to calculate and compensate the moving distance. We design the user interface of the multiple mobile robot system, and search the minimum distance using the proposed method on the experimental platform. In the experimental results, mobile robots can receive the command from the supervised computer via wireless RF interface, and move to the unknown target position, and find the optimal path on the many times test according to the proposed algorithm.

keywords.kw: path planning, multiple mobile robots, dynamic programming algorithm, compass module

article_rec.title: Dynamic Simulation of Litchi Fruit Flexible Manipulator in Picking Process

abstract.par: Litchi fruit flexible mechanical picking could reduce the loss of fresh fruit, which is the development direction of intelligent mechanized harvesting in future agriculture. According to the agronomic planting of litchi, this paper analyzed its fruit picking requirements, studied the structure of the manipulator's end effector flexible picking and its dynamic transfer, built the structure model of the manipulator automatically picking. By means of simulation software ADAMS, studied the dynamic characteristics of angular displacement, angular velocity, mass center displacement etc attached to each joint component in picking process, the simulation of the joint driving torque compared with the theoretical calculation showed the error is less than 3%. Thus, it was proved that the simulation design of litchi flexible picking manipulator met the work requirements of flexible picking, and could provide the theory reference for prototype design.

keywords.kw: dynamic simulation
end effector
flexible picking
litchi
manipulator

article_rec.title: Dynamic Weighing of the Application Based on Parameters Identification

abstract.par: In the process of agricultural Livestock of feeding, it is increasing for feed of Livestock of onLine dynamic weighing measurement demand, But the dynamic weighing is the more important and complex than the static weighing, and it is very difficulty to achieve the technology. Researching a high precision and high speed dynamic weighing algorithm is great value to improve equipment of productivity and efficiency. This article is about the general dynamic weighing system equivalenting to the general second-order control system. There derives the static and dynamic mathematical model through control theory. And it converses into the Autoregressive Moving Average Model by Laplace Transform, then it converses into Least Squares parameter identification problem. Finally, there analysises Least Squares parameter identification in the weighing process of appLication.

keywords.kw: dynamic weighing, Second-order System, Least Squares Method, Parameter Identification

article_rec.title: Effect of Interphase Composite Spacer on Transmission Line Galloping Control

abstract.par: In order to research the effect of the layout and number of interphase composite spacer on iced transmission Line galloping, five nonLinear finite element analysis models of three-phase iced transmission Lines in quad bundle were developed. The dynamic responses of iced conductors subjected to aerodynamic loads were studied, and time history curves of vertical, horizontal and torsional vibration in the transmission Lines were obtained. The results show that the layout of two interphase composite spacers can not disturb the synchronization of galloping between each phase conductors and can not control galloping, the staggered arrangement of three interphase composite spacers not only disturb the synchronization of galloping between each phase conductors, but also have a certain inhibitory effect on the first, second, third and fourth-order galloping, having better effect on galloping control.

keywords.kw: Layout of Interphase Composite Spacer, Bundle Conductor, NonLinear Finite Element, Galloping control

article_rec.title: Effect of Six Fungicides against Botrytis Cinerea on Protected Cultivation Tomato

abstract.par: Six fungicides are selected and used to control Botrytis Cinerea on tomato under protected cultivation. The fungicides include Fludioxonil, BoscaLid, Pyrimethanil (ISO, BSI), Diethofencarb, Carbendazim, Procymidone and Thiophanate-methyl. These Chemicals were sprayed three times and once a week before or in the beginning of disease development. The results show that all the six fungicides have different negative effect on the growing of Botrytis Cinerea. Two of them, 50% BoscaLid (750 g/hm2) and 50% Fludioxonil (750 g/hm2), have significantly inhibited more than 77% of disease development in leaves and fruits resulting in almost 4 times increase of yield compared with control. Other two Chemicals, 40% Pyrimethanil (1550 g/hm2) and 60% Diethofencarb-Carbendazim (1550 g/hm2) also reduced more than 49.35% of disease development in leaves and fruits resulting in 3 time increase of yield compared with control. The last two fungicides 50% Procymidone (1800 g/hm2) and 70% Thiophanate-methyl (2580 g/hm2) have less effect on Botrytis Cinerea.

keywords.kw: fungicide, Botrytis Cinerea, control efficiency, Chemical effect

article_rec.title: Effects of Air Flow Disturbance of Spool Valve on Vibration Control of Active Pneumatic Vibration Isolation System

abstract.par: Active pneumatic vibration isolation system (APVIS) is widely used in IC equipments and high precision metrology devices. Proportional spool valves are normally used as its actuator. However, it exhibits strong non-Linearity, such as dead zone and stick-sLip effect, which results in flux fluctuation, to greatly degrade the vibration isolation performance. In this paper, a dynamic model for air spring of APVIS is presented, and the active control model of APVIS is built which uses PI algorithm to control spool valve and sky-hook damper to depress the resonance. The simulation results show that vibration caused by pneumatic flux disturbance is ampLified near the resonance frequency of APVIS and pneumatic flux disturbance has great influence on vibration isolation performance between the bandwidth of 0.2~1.0Hz.

keywords.kw: Active Vibration Isolation, Active Pneumatic control, Spool Valve, Air Flow Disturbance, Air spring

article_rec.title: Elasto-plastic Collapse Strength Calculation of Casing under Pure External Pressure

abstract.par: In present, there are two main viewpoints about Elasto-plastic collapse calculation criteria of casing under pure external pressure, (1) Tresca's yield criteria, (2) Mises's yield criteria. The unified Limit external pressure expression of ideal casing is obtained on twin shear unified strength theory with considering the actual manufacture flaw to correct it. The above different viewpoint is compared with physical test data, which proves elasto-plastic collapse calculation criteria of casing being more consistent with Tresca's yield criteria and the new model in paper to estimate collapse strength of actual casing in more accurate. In theory, the effect in tension and compression as well as initial geometric flaw with different magnitude of quantity for influence of collapse strength is firstly discussed in this paper, which provides important basis for casing manufacture. It has great practical significance.

keywords.kw: twin shear unified strength theory, elasto-plastic collapse, initial geometric flaw

article_rec.title: Enhanced Plasticity of Bulk MetalLic Glass Alloys (BMGs) by Internal Microstructural Modification

abstract.par: As a new emerging field of materials, bulk metalLic glasses (BMGs) have received particular attention due to their high glass forming abiLity, desirable mechanical and Chemical properties. However, the drawback of BMGs is their Limited global room temperature plasticity that severely impedes further appLications of this material. Therefore, possible methods of enhancing plasticity have emerged from extensive studies of the deformation of metalLic glasses in compression, including introduction of second ductile crystalLine phase, phase separation and nanocrystalLization.

article_rec.title: Epoxy Grout Repair Cracks in the Maintenance of the Bridge

abstract.par: Combining Hunan provincial S211 Line town Liu Yang Shi territory head bridge maintenance reinforcement engineering, introduces the physical and mechanical properties of epoxy resin grout, epoxy resin grout proportion and the use of epoxy resin grout repairing cracks in construction technology, construction attention and reinforcement effect.

keywords.kw: Epoxy resin grout, Bridge maintenance, Crack

article_rec.title: Error Values of Measuring Real-Time Propellant Temperatures of One Rocket with Traditional Method

abstract.par: The paper researChes error values of measuring real-time propellant temperatures of one rocket with traditional method. Firstly, a temperature-rising experiment for the rocket's charge is conducted and temperatures on several chosen measurement points are tested. Secondly, the charge's unstable flow field and temperature field during the experiment are simulated, and thereby the mean temperature of the charge's propellant district at different time during the experiment, noted as, is gotten. Finally, according to the current procedure measuring the propellent's real-time temperatures and the - curve, the error of measuring real-time propellant temperatures of one rocket with traditional method is obtained.

keywords.kw: Propellant of One Rocket, Real-time Mean Temperature, Traditional Measuring Method, Measurement Error

article_rec.title: Experiment Research on Performance of Vehicle Diesel Engine with Spraying Vapor in Intake Manifold

abstract.par: Using the excess heat of exhaust gas to heat the water to vapor, by spraying the vapor into intake manifold to join combustion, the performance of vehicle diesel engine has been researChed. The experimental results demonstrate that the bsfc of experimental engine cannot be reduced markedly, the temperature of exhaust gas for experimental engine is lower than that of original engine, the torsion of experimental engine is smaller than original engine when rev is lower than 1800rpm, while the torsion is bigger when rev higher than 1800rpm, and the maximum advance is 57.4%, when experimental engine work in rated load, the NOx can be reduced from 9.0 g/kWh to 7.1g/kWh, the maximum reduction is 22.2%, the CO emission varies with the rev, but the total trend is decreased as rev increasing, the HC emission of experimental engine is lower than that of original engine, the maximum reduction is 3.7%. Little modification of the engines and independent spraying vapor system are the advantages of this method.

keywords.kw: diesel engine, intake manifold, emission, performance

article_rec.title: Experimental Study for "Quasi-uniform Wearability" Treatment of Cylinder Liner Inner Surface

abstract.par: For improving the working Life of engine cyLinder Liner, using relevant equipments, instruments and methods, the test studys the wear-resistant treatment to CyLinder Liner Inner Surface. The results showed that: after plasma beam scanning, cyLinder Liner inner surface achieved self-quenching depend on self fast cooLing and obtained aphanic martensitic structure with high hardness, Under the other experimental condition unchanged, When working current is at the range of 60∼90A, cyLinder Liner hardened layer depth, width and hardness was basically showed Linear uniformly increasing with scanning stroke increasing gradually, the homogenization degree of austenite was more fuller, Martensitic content increased gradually, retained austenite content decreased gradually. installation wear-resistant study showed that: after two-layer partition plasma beam scanning and hardening, different parts of boron cast iron cyLinder Liner wear loss was almost equal, and the working Life of original boron cast iron cyLinder Liner was raised to higher than 3 times, The process is easy to reaLizing modernization and worth of appLication and extension for Little deformation, low energy consumption, high efficiency, no pollution and good uniform wear abiLity.

keywords.kw: cyLinder Liner, plasma beam, current, depth, width, hardness, retained austenite

article_rec.title: Experimental Study on a Thickness-Adjustable Absorber for Reverberation Controlling

abstract.par: General adjustable absorbers used in acoustical design is to simply change the size of absorption/reflective surface, this kind of reverberation controlling technique is limited by the weight of absorbers and the interior wall area. Regarded these, a thickness-adjustable absorbers named Multi-film absorbing construction (MFC), was developed for more convenient reverberation controlling. In this study, an reverberation time experiments were designed to research the absorption characteristic of MFC. Test results showed that MFC commonly produces best absorption of low frequencies, and it's absorption coefficients related to the thickness of water, especially when the thickness changes within 1cm~3cm. Therefore, with participation of water the sound properties of MFC is adjustable with the thickness of water changes, which means more convenient reverberation controlling without change the absorption area.

keywords.kw: acoustic
adjustable absorbers
multi-film absorbing construction (MFC)
reverberation
scattering absorption coefficients

article_rec.title: Experimental Study on Low NOx Emission Using Blast Furnace Gas Reburning and Industrial Application in Stoker Boiler

abstract.par: To get the modification method of blast furnace gas reburning technology on one 75t/h stoker boiler, the effect of some key factors such as stoichiometric coefficient, residence time, temperature and heat ratio input on NOx formation regulation was studied on a one-dimensional test system with fuel reburning. The results showed that prolonging the reburn zone residence time can help to lower the NOx emission and the best time was 0.8s. There existed an optimum value 1.0 for reburn zone stoichiometric coefficient. The NOx reduction efficient increased with the increase of the reburn heat input and the reburn zone temperature. The use of blast furnace gas reburning technology has been successfully implemented during the modification of stoker boiler, the NOx reduction rate was over 50%.

keywords.kw: Reburn, Blast furnace gas, Stoker boiler, NOx reduction

article_rec.title: Extracting Visual Saliency Based on Multi-scale Receptive Field Template

abstract.par: a novel approach to extracting visual saLiency based on receptive field is described in this paper. Visual saLiency may be appLied potentially in object recognition and image retrieval etc. In this paper, its two key problems are solved: saLiency measurement and scale detection. Based on the receptive field hypothesis in psychology, the approach measures visual saLiency in terms of the statistical features difference between target region and background region, and detects the scale of target region adaptively with a set of multi-scale measurements in the multi-resolution framework. Its definition of visual saLiency is more close to feeLing of human vision than current ones by introduction of the theories in psychology and physiology. It is capabiLity of detecting the target varying in a wide scale range with low computation burden by combing multi-scale template with multi-resolution framework. The satisfying experimental results on real images of remote sense and natural scene show the approach is effective.

keywords.kw: Visual Attention, Visual SaLiency, Receptive Field Template

article_rec.title: Fabrication of Micro Spherical Electrode by One Pulse Electrical Discharge Machining

abstract.par: This paper describes a new method, which combines one pulse electrical discharge machining technology with electroChemical micro machining (EMM), to fabricate micro spherical electrode and micro spherical cavities. First, micro spherical electrode is fabricated by electroChemical etching with one pulse electrical discharge (OPED) machining technology. During the OPED process, the predominant parameters, such as the appLied voltage, the electric discharge duration, the peak current, which impact the fabrication of the micro spherical electrode were studied. Then, some burnished micro spherical electrodes with diameter of several ten micrometers could be formed instantaneously. At last, three micro spherical cavities were fabricated with the type of above micro spherical electrode by EMM process.

keywords.kw: One Pulse Electrical Discharge, Micro Spherical Electrode, ElectroChemical Micromachining, Micro Spherical Cavity

article_rec.title: Fast Mode Decision Based on All-Zero Block in H.264/AVC

abstract.par: In H.264/AVC, it is a common phenomenon that the transformation coefficients of a block are quantized to zero. Such block is called a all-zero block(AZB). in the process of mode decision, if a AZB can be detected early, the overhead of following transformation and quantization can be avoided. This will lead magnificent saving in encoding time. A fast mode decision algorithm based on AZBs detection in H.264/AVC is proposed in this paper. We present a more precise threshold based on the analysis on the theory of integer transform and quantization. Then, a more efficient mode decision algorithm is proposed based on the probabiLities of inter/intra modes. The simulation results show that the proposed algorithm achieve better performance in encoding time saving with ignorable PSNR degradation and a Litter bit rate saving, compare to the exist mode decision algorithms.

keywords.kw: All-zero Block, H.264/AVC, Threshold, Mode Decision

article_rec.title: Finite Element Analysis for the Equivalent Stress on Three-Dimensional Multi-asperity Coating

abstract.par: The finite element method is appLied to estabLish two-dimensional and three-dimensional models of elastic multi-asperity contact between the rigid plane and the coating surface. It is found that the changes of elastic modulus ratio, coating thickness, spacing of asperities and indentation depth of the rigid plane influence the total deformation and stress distribution in coating asperity and coating/substrate interface. The results show that the equivalent stress of 3D contact model is greater than that of 2D model due to the stress superposition of asperities. For 3D contact model, the effects of varied levels of indentation depth, coating thickness, elastic modulus ratio, spacing of asperities on the maximum equivalent stress are measured. And the smaller the elastic modulus ratio, indentation depth, spacing of asperities and the larger the coating thickness, the smaller the maximum equivalent stress in the coating surface. The coating/substrate bonding strength has been up-graded obviously by increasing the number of asperities and the coating thickness, reducing the elastic modulus ratio.

keywords.kw: multi-asperity coating, three dimensional contact model, equivalent stress, finite element method

article_rec.title: Finite Element Analysis of Crankshaft by ABAQUS

abstract.par: The crankshaft is one of the most important parts in the internal combustion engine, it changes the force from the connecting rod into the torque around its axis. To ensure the reLiabiLity of the work, the crankshaft sHould have sufficient strength and stiffness. Based on the structure and the working principle of diesel engine, the CATIA software is appLied to estabLish three-dimensional soLid model of a single cyLinder diesel engine's crankshaft, and then the stress analysis and modal analysis of the crankshaft are carried out using the ABAQUS software. The reference is provided for the design of the crankshaft and improvement.

keywords.kw: Crankshaft, Finite Element, Strength, Model Analysis

article_rec.title: Forming of Surface Quality when Cutting Parts Using Ultrasound Liquid Flow

abstract.par: Aiming at quaLity problem and influencing factors easily appearing on the surface when cutting parts using ultrasound Liquid flow, this article carried on the thorough analysis, and proposed that the surface quaLity and accuracy of parts were closely related with design process factors, consisting of parameters of cutting machine, cutting process and hydrauLic system. High-quaLity machined surface can be obtained, only with fully organic consideration to design process factors. Furthermore, some factors that sHould be considered in simulation of basic research on ultrasound Liquid flow cutting were put forward.

keywords.kw: ultrasound Liquid flow cutting, formation of surface quaLity, design process factors

article_rec.title: FTA at the Semi-automatic Machine for Implanting Nuts into Shells of Phones

abstract.par: EstabLish the fault tree model of the semi-automatic implanting machine, and analysis all subsystems' reLiabiLity quantitatively according to the failure data of the testing machine, in order to find out the weakest Link and potential weaknesses of this system. And then propose the corresponding measures to improve the design and improve its reLiabiLity.

keywords.kw: System, ReLiabiLity, Fault Tree

article_rec.title: Fundamental Study on Fiber Bragg Grating Network for High Speed Collisions Detection

abstract.par: A real-time damage monitoring system for the high speed colLision using Fiber Bragg Grating (FBG) sensor network is proposed in this paper. This system can not only detect and alarm the high speed colLision, but also helps to detect the change of other physical parameters, such as temperature, electromagnetic field. The basic optical and electronic theories about this system, as well as the mechanism and mechanics model of FBG sensors, are expressed in this paper.

keywords.kw: Fiber Bragg Grating, shockwave, high-speed colLision, stress, effective load

article_rec.title: Fuzzy PID Control for a Class of Distributed Parameter Systems

abstract.par: The control of distribute parameter systems (DPSs) is difficult because they are spatio-temporal coupLing. A fuzzy control strategy is proposed to control a class of DPSs. Firstly, the class of DPS is partitioned into a finite-dimensional slow one and an infinite-dimensional fast component by using time/space separation method. Secondly, the fuzzy control strategy is designed based on the finite-dimensional slow component. The fuzzy control strategy consists of finite-dimensional fuzzy PID controllers. Finally, the proposed method is used to control a rod reaction process. The simulations show the effective of the proposed control method.

keywords.kw: distributed parameter systems, time/space separation, fuzzy PID control

article_rec.title: GIS-Based Assessment of Roof-Mounted Solar Energy Potential in Jiangsu, China

abstract.par: Due to high risk of unstable supply from fossil energy and growing concern with the preservation of the environment, well-developed Jiangsu province in China is hungering for alternative energy resources to catalyze stupendous economic growth. Assessing the technically available potential of solar energy spatially and temporally over the whole province might be able to improve the unfavorable situation. This paper presented a GIS based scenario model for assessing available roof-mounted solar energy resource. Its implementation in Jiangsu gave an estimation that annual electrical production capacity could meet about 40% of the local demand. Further results analysis shows that, altHough there are two disadvantages of wide use of roof-mounted PV system:High cost and great variations, the huge potential might make this system an essential component of the energy suppLies in view of a continuous drop in the PV cost with advances in technology. Popularizing this building-integrated PV system might be a strategic option for overcoming the predicament of energy shortage and reducing carbon dioxide emissions, thus contributing to the sustainable development.

keywords.kw: Available solar energy, RMPV, Jiangsu, China, GIS

article_rec.title: Harmonic and Inter-harmonic Signal Analysis Based on Hilbert-Huang Transform

abstract.par: Because of the extensive appLication of the non-Linear electrical equipment, aircraft power system contains a number of harmonic and inter-harmonic components. Aiming at the situation that Fourier transform and wavelet transform method could not effectively extract and analyze these harmonic and inter-harmonic signal, made use of Hilbert-Huang Transform (HHT) to extract and analyze harmonic and inter-harmonic components for the aircraft power system. Meanwhile, in order to solve the question of overshoots/undershoots existing during empirical mode decomposition(EMD), made use of cubic Hermite polynomial interpolation instead of cubic spLine interpolation to extract the envelope curve. The result of simulation shows that HHT can effectively extract and analyze harmonic and inter-harmonic components for the aircraft power system.

keywords.kw: Hilbert-Huang Transform (HHT), Empirical Mode Decomposition (EMD), harmonic, inter-harmonic signal

article_rec.title: Helical Intake Port Design and Experimental Analysis of Horizontal Diesel Engine

abstract.par: As the shape structure of heLical intake port is complex, the full reaLization of the forward direction design still faces some difficulties and challenges. In order to estabLish the inlet model directly, a new method of design is used to complete the construction of physical model, meanwhile the flow field in interior space of inlet and cyLinder is investigated. The simulation results show that by modification of value scales of parameters on the transition angle α, and heLix slope angle β and the bottom slope angle ζ, the soLid models with significantly different performance can be regenerated, at the maximum valve Lift, the flow coefficient is altered in the range from 0.563 to 0.736. The cyLinder head products with three different inlet models are tested on the steady flow test platform. By comparison of experimental results with the calculated values, it is found that simulative results can wonderfully indicate inlet performance variation. The combination way of forward direct modeLing and performance simulation method is capable of improving the design efficiency of the intake port.

keywords.kw: HeLical intake port, Forward direction design, Flow field analysis, Steady flow test

article_rec.title: H-infinity Filter Design for Uncertain Markovian Jump Singular Stochastic Systems

abstract.par: This paper deals with the problem of robust H-infinity filter design for uncertain Markovian jump singular systems with Wiener process. The system under consideration involves parameter uncertainties, Markovian jump parameters and It-type stochastic disturbances. The aim of the paper is to design a H-infinity filter such that, for all admissiable uncertainties, the filtering error system is robustly stochastically mean-square stable, and a prescribed disturbance attenuation level is guaranteed. A sufficient condition for the existence of an H-infinity filter for the system under consideration is achieved in terms of LMIS(Linear matrix inequaLities). Moreover, the expLicit expression of the desired filter parameters is given.

keywords.kw: H-infinity filter, singular stochastic systems, LMIS

article_rec.title: High Speed Real-Time Data Acquisition System Based on Solid-State Storage Technique

abstract.par: This paper presented a high speed data acquisition system for real-time appLication. The hardware of system mainly consists of data acquisition, distribution and storage section. A 3Gsps ultra high-speed ADC is appLied in acquisition section. In distribution section, the original data stream will be distributed into four streams. Each data stream will be stored into one soLid-state storage card which is composed of NAND flash array. In aspect of software, implementation methods of DDR3-based FIFO and NAND flash controller were introduced in detail. System evaluation results show that system achieved high bandwidth (up to 3.0GB/s) and good SNR (up to 45dB).

keywords.kw: data acquisition system, high-speed, real-time, soLid-state storage, FPGA

article_rec.title: Histogram-Preserving Steganography Using Maximum Flow Algorithms

abstract.par: A novel sCheme of histogram-preserving steganography is proposed in this article. In this new sCheme, the problem of statistical restoration is interpreted as a Linear programming problem and solved using maximum flow algorithms. The experimental results show that our sCheme can effectively diminish the relative entropy between the cover and stego images even when the information is embedded at the maximum rate.

keywords.kw: steganography, statistical restoration, maximum flows, histogram-preserving, Linear programming

article_rec.title: Human Abnormal Action Identification Method in Different Scenarios

abstract.par: The detection of human abnormal action is very important in video surveillance. In order to detecting human abnormal action in different scenarios, we can use a method of double-layer Bag-of-Words model. In this method, the video information is firstly processed using Bag-of-Words, and the information of motion text words and scenarios are included in another bag. A video sequence is represented as a codebook of spatial-temporal words by extracting space-time interest points. An action characteristic is determined by behavior text words in special scenarios. A model of Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) is appLied to automatically learn the distribution of spatial-temporal words and the topics correspond to human action categories. And it also learns the probabiLity distributions of the motion text words in a scenario with supervisor and the intermediate topics corresponding to anomalous or normal action. All of these are achieved by using the Latent Dirichlet Allocation model. Through this method, we can categorize the human action normal or abnormal in a special occasion to a new video. Thus we can advance corresponding security measures.

keywords.kw: Video surveillance, Abnormal action, Interest points, Bag-of-words, Hybrid Latent Dirichlet Allocation

article_rec.title: Hybrid PCA-SVM Method for Pattern Recognition of Chatter Gestation

abstract.par: To distinguish chatter gestation, chatter recognition method based on hybrid PCA(Principal Compenent Analysis) and SVM(Support Vector Machine) is proposed for dynamic patterns of chatter gestation in cutting process. At first, FFT features are extracted from the vibration signal of cutting process, then FFT vectors are presorted and introduced to PCA-SVM for machine learning and classification. Finally the results of chatter gestation recognition and chatter prediction experiments are presented and show that the method proposed is effective.

keywords.kw: Chatter Gestation, PCA, SVM, Pattern Recognition

article_rec.title: Hydraulic Excavator Hybrid Power System Parameters Design

abstract.par: The parameter design of main components of hydrauLic excavator, mostly based on the specific structure of the system, has bad universaLity. In order to find a method that is versatile and has simple calculation process, it is figured out that different kinds of hybrid power system have the same path in the transfer of energy. The distribution of energy is decided by the upper Limit of direct power from the diesel engine. The upper Limit of direct power from the diesel engine, which could characterize the hybrid system, is used as the independent variable. The common expressions of the main components' installed parameter are deduced from the load curve. These expressions are used to design the parameters on a certain 7t hydrauLic excavator. The result shows that this method can be used to carry out parameter matching on different hybrid system and also shows significant reference value on choosing the overall plan of the hybrid system.

keywords.kw: HydrauLic Excavator, Hybrid Power System, Parameter Design

article_rec.title: Ideas and Tactics for Achieving Sustainable Development of Local Agriculture

abstract.par: Under the correct leadership of Xuchang municipal government, Xuchang economic strength of agriculture has steadily increased since the national Eleventh Five-Year. agricultural production capacity has increased, the rapid development of industriaLization of agriculture, agricultural science and technology as well as the level of agricultural modernization also has been significantly improved significantly. This paper will attempt to give a comprehensive summary of the "Eleventh Five-Year " period of Xuchang in the brilLiant achievements of agricultural development. Then it will analyze the existed difficulties and problems and propose ideas and measures for achieving sustainable development of agriculture during the" second five ".

keywords.kw: Sustainable Development, Local Agriculture, Ideas, tactics

article_rec.title: Image Deblurring Regularized by Wavelet Probability Shrink

abstract.par: An image deblurring algorithm based on wavelet probabiLity shrink regularization is proposed. Denoise and deblur were alternatively executed by least square approximate and probabiLity shrinkage. After several iterations of deblur, probabiLity shrink based on stationary wavelet transform (SWT) were used once for denoising. Experimental results show that proposed algorithm obtained better results on several benchmark images than classical regularization techniques such as wavelet soft shrink, TV, or even non-local TV proposed more recently.

keywords.kw: Image Deblurring, Wavelet Shrink, Stationary Wavelet Transform (SWT), ProbabiLity Shrink

article_rec.title: Image Denoising Algorithm Using Neighbourhood Characteristics and Cycle Spinning

abstract.par: A new adaptive shrinkage denoising approach based on contourlet transform is presented. Classical contourlet-based denoising method processes the contourlet coefficients with a fixed threshold in each sub band, witHout considering the neighbourhood characteristics of the coefficients, and introduces artifacts due to the lack of translation invariance of the contourlet transform. We propose an improved shrinkage threshold in contourlet domain which makes good use of the clustering property of contourlet coefficients, and use cycle spinning to compensate for the lack of translation invariance of the contourlet transform. Thus, the new denoising algorithm proposed achieves better tradeoff between details retain and noises removal, and effectively reduces the artifacts. Experiments on test images show that the proposed method outperforms the classical contourlet-based denoising method, in terms of both PSNR values and visual quaLity.

keywords.kw: contourlet transform, denoising, cycle spinning

article_rec.title: Implementation of the Multiple Tasks Allocation Problem for Mobile Robots

abstract.par: The article researChes path planning of the multiple task allocation problems using searching algorithms for multiple mobile robots, and solves the shortest path problems such that mobile robots can move from multiple start points to reach all task points in a colLision-free space. The searching algorithms contain auction algorithm, greedy algorithm and 2-opt exchange heuristic algorithm. In this manner, the supervised computer constructs the motion paths using sequential single-item auction algorithm to search all task points for multiple mobile robots, and use greedy algorithm and 2-opt exchange heuristic algorithm to improve the shortest paths from the previous motion paths. That is to say, the total displacement of the multiple mobile robots is minimal. The supervised computer controls the mobile robots searching all task points from multiple start points through the other points via wireless RF interface. We develop the user interface to help users filLing the position data of the mobile robots and all task points, and program the motion paths of multiple mobile robots using the proposed algorithms. It can display the previous motion path and the improving motion paths of mobile robots on real-time using the proposed algorithms. The simulated results present that the proposed algorithms can find the shortest motion paths for mobile robots moving to all task points from multiple start points in a colLision-free space. Finally, we implement the experiment scenario using the four module-based mobile robots that move on the motion platform according to the programmed motion paths.

keywords.kw: multiple tasks allocation problems, auction algorithm, greedy algorithm, 2-opt exchange algorithm, wireless RF interface

article_rec.title: Improved FP-Growth Algorithm for Freeway Surveillance Network Intrusion Detection System

abstract.par: This paper introduces network toll highway network structure and characteristics of the monitoring, analysis of the monitoring network and office network Internet security problems, make use of the improved FP algorithm for network monitoring intrusion detection, and used the method in Guangdong provincial highway surveillance network system, the results show that not only effectively prevent the intrusion, but also improve the data mining of time.

keywords.kw: formatting, Network monitoring, network security, Intrusion Detection Improved FP-Growth algorithm

article_rec.title: Improvement and AppLication of MKSVM

abstract.par: Grinding production rate (GPR) is a vital index of grinding process. Getting accurate and timely information of GPR is the premise of enhancing grinding efficiency and conducting optimization control. However, for complexity of grinding process, there is no effective method to on-Line predict GPR. On the basis of soft sensor principle, a new sCheme that applying improved mixed-kernel support vector machine (MKSVM) to predict GPR is presented. Meanwhile nesting termination condition genetic algorithm (NTCGA) is proposed to improve the deficiency of MKSVM that there is no effectual way to select parameters of MKSVM's kernel. Furthermore comparison experiments of prediction between the improved MKSVM and traditional support vector machines (SVMs) and radial basis function (RBF) network are conducted. Simulation results show the prediction accuracy of GPR by using the improved MKSVM can meet the demand of practical appLications. And performance of improved MKSVM is much better than other SVMs and RBF network.

keywords.kw: Soft Sensor, Support Vector Machine, Genetic Algorithm, Mmixed-kernel, Radial Basis Function

article_rec.title: Incorporating Domain High-Level Concepts into Heuristic Searches
article_rec.subtitle: A Case Study on Identifying Plant Species in Remote Sensing Images

abstract.par: In order to take domain expert knowledge as a supplement of the machine "intelLigence", a High-Level-Concept-based framework (HLC) for heuristic search is proposed. HLC has domain experts actively generaLize their own psychological feeLings about image features into high-level concepts, then write down them in descriptors, and make the domain high-level concepts enter a heuristic search with a multi-descriptor combination. These so-called "descriptors" are a kind of non-threshold models so that they have reusabiLity and generaLization. To demonstrate the idea, 18 new descriptor have been designed. The examinations of discrimination accuracy indicate that in a multi-descriptor space, the error rates of classification is 67.91% lower than that in a spectral-brightness space.

keywords.kw: descriptors, domain high-level concepts, machine discrimination, plant species

article_rec.title: Induced Wheel-Based Study on Point Contact Kinematics Modeling for Ultra-Precision Grinding

abstract.par: While point contact kinematics has been recognized as the standard kinematics in ultra-precision grinding of off-axis aspheric optics, its modeLing which is the prerequisite for grinding force, energy and thermal modeLing in this kinematics has not been fully explored. It is by no means an easy task due to the lack of mathematic model for freeform wheel-work piece conformity. This paper presents a mathematic concept defined as induced wheel, based on the relative curvature of wheel and work piece, to quantitatively describe the uneven grinding situation within contact region. The grinding force model in point contact kinematics is deduced based on induced wheel.

keywords.kw: ultra-precision grinding, off-axis aspheric optics, point contact kinematics, relative curvature

article_rec.title: Influence of Alq3
article_rec.subtitle: C545T on Luminescence of Blue LED

abstract.par: Organic material Alq3:C545T was deposited on the glass By vacuum evaporation. The thicknesses were 0nm, 40nm, 80nm, 120 nm, 200 nm and 400 nm while the doping ratio of C545T was 2%. Light-emitting properties were researChed by blue LED radiating Organic film. The results show that blue LED chip will stimulate Alq3:c545T generating yellow and green Light in the spectral region of 500-600nm. With the increasing of thickness, radiation spectrum is improved. Meanwhile, Luminous efficiency and the flux of LED are increased significantly, which are 2.85 and 2.48 times of original, respectively, then red shift occurs. Through the C545T mixing test, we can see that mixing C545T(2%) into Alq3 would improve the luminous efficiency of LED significantly.

keywords.kw: LED, organic materials, radiation spectrum, luminescence

article_rec.title: Initial Version of State Transition Algorithm

abstract.par: In terms of the concepts of state and state transition, a new algorithm-State Transition Algorithm (STA) is proposed in order to probe into classical and intelLigent optimization algorithms. On the basis of state and state transition, it becomes much simpler and easier to understand. As for continuous function optimization problems, three special operators named rotation, translation and expansion are presented. While for discrete function optimization problems, an operator called general elementary transformation is introduced. Finally, with 4 common benchmark continuous functions and a discrete problem used to test the performance of STA, the experiment shows that STA is a promising algorithm due to its good search capabiLity.

keywords.kw: State transition algorithm, rotation, translation, expansion, general elementary transformation

article_rec.title: The Research on Engineering Machinery Products Form Innovation Design Based on TRIZ

abstract.par: Based on the TRIZ idea and theories, aiming to the practical problems of Engineering mechanical product form design, the thesis studies the design of the small-size digger for the municipal maintenance projects, and advises TRIZ appLication and popularization in the field of mechanical products.

keywords.kw: TRIZ theories, engineering mechanical, product form design

article_rec.title: Input-to-State Stability of Discrete-Time Switched Systems

abstract.par: In this paper some results are obtained on input-to-state stabiLity and -weighted summable input-to-state stabiLity for discrete-time switChed system under average dwell-time switching signals, and an example is presented toillustrate the results.

keywords.kw: SwitChed systems, Input-to-state stabiLity, weighted summable input-to-state stabiLity

article_rec.title: Insulating Oil Level Monitoring System for Transformer Based on Liquid Level Sensor

abstract.par: In view of difficult for the power transformer insulating oil level in the real-time onLine monitoring of the artificial. Using fiber Bragg grating as the insulating oil level sensor. TMS320F2812 digital signal processor was used as the processing and control core. Analyzed the structural principle of fiber Bragg grating sensor and its demodulation system, introduced the hardware components and software implementation. Experimental results show that the system has high precision measurement, good stabiLity and reLiabiLity.

keywords.kw: power transformer, DSP, Liquid level sensor, fiber Bragg grating Sensor, insulating oil

article_rec.title: Internet of Things-Based Positioning of Coalmine Personnel and Monitoring of Emergency State

abstract.par: Nowadays, following an accident in coalmines, what affects emergent rescue efficiency is mainly attributable to the uncertain positions and physiological state of coalmine ersonnel. In view of such problem, the wireless communication network and its node structure were designed for coalmines with the aid of the emerging ZigBee technique. With this system, the information on the coalmine personnel is collected by the portable terminal node placed in the miners' lamp cap. Then, the data is transmitted via the underground wireless network to the emergency rescue center on the surface, which helps to reaLize positioning of personnel and monitoring of emergency state and provide assistance for effectively conducting emergency rescue.

keywords.kw: Internet of things, Personnel positioning, Emergency state, Monitoring

article_rec.title: Investigation and Development on Integrated Design of Engineering Clamp Hanger

abstract.par: This paper investigates the cased-based design of the engineering clamp hangers and develops an integrated computer-aimed design system, aiming at optimizing the whole hanger structure and meanwhile keeping the strength security. The structure and the working load status of the clamp hanger are firstly analyzed. Then the general tHought, the structure design, the model Check & strength verification, and the structure optimization of the hanger inelegant design are respectively presented. Finally, the SoLid Edge-based integrated computer-aimed design system is developed under VB6.0. The developed system may greatly improve the design efficiency and the precision, optimize the hanger structure and meanwhile ensure the hanger's strength security. The presented work in this paper has reference value and active meaning.

keywords.kw: Engineering Clamp Hanger, Integrated Design, Case-Based Inference, Structure Optimization

article_rec.title: Key Engineering and Programming Technology of High Speed Numerical Control Milling

abstract.par: The cutting tools and programmed optimization of cutting speeds and feeds, such as tool selection and CAM of procedure draw up technology in high speed NC milLing is analyzed. This paper summarised put forward some problems that sHould be taken care of in the high speed NC milLing. The key engineering and programming technology of high speed and effective NC milLing is analyzed. Practical base of high speed and effective NC milLing is provided. High speed and effective NC milLing some problems is settled for hard to cut materials as nonferrous metals or aluminums alloy. It obtains good result in practical appLications.

keywords.kw: High speed milLing, Numerical Control (NC), Engineering Technology, Programming

article_rec.title: Key Techniques Analysis on Surface Restructuring Based on Diffraction Grating Projection Photography

abstract.par: The study is on a caLibration method for grating projection plane in 3D image measurement system and discussing the problems need to be noted in appLication. It brings forward a new method for curving surface based on 3D on-Line measuring points, according to the on-Line distribution rule of 3D points group on the grating projection measuring system. In portrait image reconstructing, this method can generate good-character triangles, avoid missing points, cracks or holes and produce a smooth and consecutive curving surface.

keywords.kw: Grating projection, 3D plane caLibration, 3D photography, Surface restructuring

article_rec.title: Key Techniques Research on a New Vehicular Speech Recognition System

abstract.par: This paper proposes a new vehicular speech recognition system, which uses the multipLication of the frame energy and frame zero-crossing rate as index quantity to test the speech activity, meanwhile, takes MFCC as speech signal feature vector, and recognizes speech based on HMM speech recognition model. In addition, a new method of anti-noise Speech Recognition is discussed in this article. Through improved iterative Wiener filters together with PUM model, the new method can be more effective to suppress noise interference and improve speech recognition rate.

keywords.kw: Speech recognition, Mel Frequeney Cepstrum Coeffieien, PUM, Noise

article_rec.title: Key Technology Research on the Flexible Welding Line for Multi-model Automobile

abstract.par: The paper shows that estabLishing the flexible multi-model welding Line (FMWL) is necessary, which is the key technology for the flexible production. In this paper, some measures for implementing the flexible welding Line for multi-model automobile were proposed from several aspects, such as process planning, switching mechanism, the robot interactive simulation, and automatic integrated control. And the modular strategy was used to achieve the production of different models.

keywords.kw: the flexible multi-model welding Line, process planning, switching mechanism, interactive simulation, automatic integrated control

article_rec.title: Kinematics Modeling and Real-Time Seam Tracking for Welding Mobile Robot

abstract.par: Kinematics modeLing of the developed welding mobile robot is presented and a real time seam tracking algorithm based on fuzzy neural network is proposed. At first, the kinematics behavior of mobile robot body and cross sLiders action to the welding torch are investigated by the Denavit-Hartenberg(D-H) Homogeneous transformation method, and a full kinematics model is estabLished. And then a seam tracking controller based on fuzzy-gaussian neural network (FGNN) is described by applying a Gaussian function as an activation function, lateral sLider position and heading angle of the robot act as input signals, and adjusted angle for welding torch acts as output, a speciaLized learning architecture is used so that membership function can be tuned in real time by applying the back propagation algorithm of FGNN controller. The experiment results show that the proposed controller has excellent tracing accuracy (within 0.5mm), and can satisfy the requirement of practical welding project.

keywords.kw: Kinematics model, Welding mobile robot, Seam tracking, Fuzzy neural network

article_rec.title: Large Sample Detection and Optimal Distribution Models of Vehicle Brake Performance

abstract.par: To improve and optimize vehicle brake safety, using large sample detection, multi-parameter data analysis and mathematical model technical means, actual detection and corresponding sample data statistical analysis are carry out on 6 brake performance of a a given type commercial vehicles, then the optimal fitting distribution and their respective distribution parameters are determined. On this basis, 6 distributive models which correspond to different brake performance are estabLished. Comparing the model calculation results and large sample data actual detection results, the calculation error average can be know only 1.775%. The research is of great significance on evaluating vehicle brake performance accurately, indicating further improvement and optimization directions and improving vehicle brake safety.

keywords.kw: Vehicle engineering, Brake safety, Performance detection, Distributive modeLing, Improvement, optimization

article_rec.title: Link Performance Analysis for Ultrawide Bandwidth RFID

abstract.par: Because of the outstanding advantage, the ultrawide bandwidth technology (UWB) is put forwards into appLication of the radio frequency identification (RFID) systems. In this paper, the general system structure of UWB-RFID and the backscatter modulation is presented. The Link budget of time-hopping pulse position modulation (TH-PPM) in AWGN channel is analyzed, which is based on the emission mark of FCC for the UWB signal. At last, the performance of Link budget in UWB-RFID system is presented in terms of transmission range and data rate.

keywords.kw: UWB, RFID, TH-PPM, Emission Mark

article_rec.title: Liquid Flow Detection System Based on Wireless Sensor Network

abstract.par: As the wireless technology compared with the traditional wired technology has a lot of advantages, it has been widely used at enterprise level as a good way to improve system performance and reduce cost. On analysis of the system characteristics of industrial Liquid flow detection in pipes, a ZigBee wireless sensor network has been developed which can simultaneously detect multiple pipeLine flow and reaLize remote monitoring.
