Except pharmaceutical plants' and rubber plants' former sites, majority types of sites have very high risks beyond 90%, 18 times of model's defaulted setting level(α=0.05). That means some further remediation steps must be taken into account.

keywords.kw: IEUBK model, CHongqing, Site, Assessment of ecological risk

article_rec.title: Virtual Assembly and Kinematic Simulation of Micro-segment Helical Gear Based on CATIA

abstract.par: Micro-segment heLical gear is a new gear, and the tooth is made up of two "convex - concave" parts, which are different from the traditional in volute gear. In order to further understand and study the characteristics of this gear, the contour calculation about a pair of gears with given parameters is given in the first, and then the 3D models are set up with CATIA. Then the virtual assembly is finished using this software. At last, the kinematic simulation is suppLied by the "DMU (an compositive module in CATIA )" to analyze the motion characteristics. The study here is important to enhance design level and theoretical analysis capacity of the gear, and to speed up the appLication process at the same time.

keywords.kw: Micro-segment Gear, CATIA, Virtual Assembly, Kinematic Simulation

article_rec.title: Visual Simulation of Upland Rice Root as Related to Soil Compaction

abstract.par: The morphological characteristics and the growth features of upland rice root was investigated. A three-dimensional visual simulation model was put forward by using architectural parameters of upland rice root system. Compared with paddy rice root system, the upland rice root system showed different three-dimensional growth rules because the upland rice grew in compaction soil. Therefore upland rice root system model included particular initial location, time of adventitious roots, rate of radial growth, rate of axial growth, the initial stretching angle, and the spatial distribution, etc. The visual simulation of dynamic growth of upland rice root was implemented with SimRoot, a structural-functional model with emphasis on the architecture and function of the root system. The visual simulation not only shows vivid three dimensional structure of dynamic root growth, but also impLies the effect of soil compaction on upland rice root system, which provides a effective methodology for researching on soil-plant system.

keywords.kw: upland rice, root, geometric model, topological structure, visual simulation

article_rec.title: Visual-Based Manufacturing Platform Level Detection Method

abstract.par: This paper proposes a visual-based method for detecting the tilt angles of a platform using a single image. A particular circular reference object is used to provide information of the tilt angles via projective geometry. The image features of the reference object extracted by the basic rectangle and corner detection algorithm are used for ANFIS to estimate the tilt angles. The method is verified by simulation that it can detect the tilt angles very closely. Moreover, the method offers a very easy and low-cost approach for manufacturing appLications.

keywords.kw: image process, platform tilt detection, ANFIS

article_rec.title: Wavelet Packet Quantization Analysis Technique in Real-Time Feature Extraction and Condition Monitoring of Quayside Container Crane Motor Based on EMD

abstract.par: Based on the introduction of the Empirical Mode Decomposition (EMD), Wavelet Packet Quantization Analysis Technology is presented in this paper. According to the features including heavy-load, high-speed and huge-impact of the real-time signals of the quayside container crane, the feature information can be extracted effectively by means of this technique. The appLication to the large-scale crane belonged to a Shanghai container-company shows that this technique is an on-Line and real-time method for the feature extraction and condition monitoring of the crane.

keywords.kw: Empirical Mode Decomposition, Wavelet Packet, Quantization Analysis, Feature Extraction, Condition Monitoring
